what: Calculating the cross-sectional area of a stream
title: xs-area
text: guide, ’ll take two approaches calculating area: one non-georeferenced data (.e., just table measurements, seen testxs), one georeferenced data (made sf).

previous_headings: Calculating the cross-sectional area of a stream
title: xs-area
text: Suppose dataset like exists testxs: ’ll notice data linear units listen [ft]. comes units package. Units measurement aren’t necessary – functions work fine without – ’s definitely good practice ensure ’re calculating accurate results! Anyways, wish calculate cross-sectional area stream, “x coordinate” (TAPE) “z-coordinate” (InvertRod). Bankful column represents bankful height, “reference” depth measurement. calculate cross-sectional area, excess uses Trapezoidal Rule:  trapezoidal area can defined : \[= \frac{1}{2} (x_n - x_{n-1})(y_n + y_{n-1})\] implementation R, can use dplyr::lag() dplyr::lead() functions.
code: library(excess) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) library(units) #> udunits database from /usr/share/xml/udunits/udunits2.xml head(testxs) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   TAPE InvertRod Bankful #>   [ft]      [ft]    [ft] #> 1 0        -0.83   -3.29 #> 2 1        -1.01   -3.29 #> 3 3        -1.48   -3.29 #> 4 4.7      -1.19   -3.29 #> 5 5.95     -1.19   -3.29 #> 6 9.8      -1.93   -3.29

title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: excess package designed provide set tools workflows analyze interpret hydrological cross-sectional data. package currently development, use caution 😄.

title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: can install development version excess GitHub :

title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: hood, xs_area() function calculates area cross-section use trapezoidal rule, provided pracma package. can visualize cross-sections xs_ribbon()  information, check vignettes navigating https://brownhr.github.io/excess
code: library(excess) library(units) #> udunits database from C:/Users/brownhr/AppData/Local/R/cache/R/renv/cache/v5/R-4.2/x86_64-w64-mingw32/units/0.8-0/6c374b265ba437f8d384ec7a313edd96/units/share/udunits/udunits2.xml library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  head(testxs) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   TAPE InvertRod Bankful #>   [ft]      [ft]    [ft] #> 1 0        -0.83   -3.29 #> 2 1        -1.01   -3.29 #> 3 3        -1.48   -3.29 #> 4 4.7      -1.19   -3.29 #> 5 5.95     -1.19   -3.29 #> 6 9.8      -1.93   -3.29 ## If you can't find the `testdata` object, load it with data()  data(testxs) testxs %>%    xs_area(tape = TAPE,           depth = InvertRod,           baseline = Bankful,           sum_area = T) #> -23.4665 [ft^2] xs_ribbon(testxs)

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: Calculate area cross-section using trapezoidal rule integration. default, uses columns "TAPE" measurement across xs, "InvertRod" depth relative y = 0, "Bankful" baseline measurement.

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
code: xs_area(data, tape, depth, baseline, sum_area = TRUE)

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: data data.frame cross-section data tape column data numeric vector tape readings ("x coordinates"). depth column data numeric vector rod readings ("y coordinates"). baseline column data vector representing bankfull level. sum_area logical (default TRUE) indicating whether return single summary trapezoidal area tibble indicating area section.

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: Double cross-sectional area compared baseline

what: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
title: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
text: xs_area() creates area plot cross-section, using ggplot2::geom_ribbon(). Currently, small inaccuracies exist channel bed crosses y-intercept created baseline, function visualization . (hopefully) fixed future version package.

text: .data data.frame cross-section data x_cor column x-coordinates (default, TAPE) depth column rod readings, relative 0 (.e. >0) (default, InvertRod) baseline column baseline readings (default, Bankful) ... arguments passed methods.
